title: Coverage doesn't work for JVM targets with buildbarn FUSE workers
body:
### Description of the bug:


Running `coverage` on Java targets with buildbarn FUSE workers fails on compilation instrumentation post-processing with following
<details>
<summary>java.nio.file.FileAlreadyExistsException: bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/bin/bazel-out/k8-fastbuild/bin/liblib.jar-coverage-metadata/com/cognite/Lib.class.uninstrumented</summary>
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystem.move(UnixFileSystem.java:906)
	at java.base/sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystemProvider.move(UnixFileSystemProvider.java:309)
	at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.move(Files.java:1430)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.instrumentation.JacocoInstrumentationProcessor$1.visitFile(JacocoInstrumentationProcessor.java:136)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.instrumentation.JacocoInstrumentationProcessor$1.visitFile(JacocoInstrumentationProcessor.java:113)
	at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree(Files.java:2786)
	at java.base/java.nio.file.Files.walkFileTree(Files.java:2857)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.instrumentation.JacocoInstrumentationProcessor.instrumentRecursively(JacocoInstrumentationProcessor.java:111)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.instrumentation.JacocoInstrumentationProcessor.processRequest(JacocoInstrumentationProcessor.java:85)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.SimpleJavaLibraryBuilder.buildJar(SimpleJavaLibraryBuilder.java:151)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.SimpleJavaLibraryBuilder.run(SimpleJavaLibraryBuilder.java:120)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.BazelJavaBuilder.build(BazelJavaBuilder.java:111)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.BazelJavaBuilder.parseAndBuild(BazelJavaBuilder.java:91)
	at com.google.devtools.build.buildjar.BazelJavaBuilder.main(BazelJavaBuilder.java:75)

</details>

The issue is that `JacocoInstrumentationProcessor` https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/blob/master/src/java_tools/buildjar/java/com/google/devtools/build/buildjar/instrumentation/JacocoInstrumentationProcessor.java#L93 is doing recursive directory traversal while also moving&creating files in same directories.

POSIX `readdir` doesn't specify if files added since the traversal start will be visible
https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007904875/functions/readdir_r.html
> If a file is removed from or added to the directory after the most recent call to [opendir()](https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007904875/functions/opendir.html) or [rewinddir()](https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/007904875/functions/rewinddir.html), whether a subsequent call to readdir_r() returns an entry for that file is unspecified.

In buildbarn FUSE case they do show up, flow:
- find uninstrumented `.class` file
- move it to `.class.uninstrumented`
- write instrumented class back to `.class` (new file!)
- remove `.class.uninstrumented`
- find `.class` file again (this time it's already instrumented)
- moving to `.class.uninstrumented` fails because destination already exists
